result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin R. Kubisiak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 50% of gross.

*Provide DNA sample, if not already done so 
*No contact with co-defendant, Paul Dopp

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Benjamin R. Kubisiak in court with attorney Eric Sheets. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 16CF47 & 16CF432.

8:34 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.

Court and counsel have received their copies of the PSI.
Court questions if any correction need to be made on the record.
Atty Sheets indicates that he has 2 corrections to the PSI and states these on the record.
Prosecutor argues regarding sentencing.
Attorney for Defendant argues regarding sentencing.
Defendant makes a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
16CF47:
Count 1 -
Impose/Stay 4 year prison sentence - concurrent
2 years of initial confinement - if probation revoked, eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program
2 years of extended supervision - would be the same as probation conditions
37 days of incarceration credit, if probation is revoked
**Placed on Probation for 36 months - concurrent
Conditions of Probation:
* Maintain absolute sobriety for the duration of supervision for both alcohol and controlled substances
* Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.
* Complete an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with recommendations given
* Provide DNA sample, if not already completed
*No contact with co-defendant, Paul Dopp 
*Complete 90 days jail on each case, concurrent with the other counts, with consideration for home detention for the second half of his sentence if acceptable by the jail administration
after having completed the first 45 days in jail with Huber privileges for counseling and employment
*60 days to report for jail to commence
*Report to jail today for start date
*Pay costs
*Pay DNA Surcharge
*Pay costs and assessments in full 90 days prior to discharge from probation

Count 3 - 
Impose/Stay 4 year prison sentence - consecutive to Count 1 
2 years of initial confinement - if probation revoked, eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program
2 years of extended supervision - would be the same as probation conditions
37 days of incarceration credit, if probation is revoked
**Placed on Probation for 36 months - concurrent
Conditions of Probation:
*Pay costs
*Pay DNA Surcharge
*Pay costs and assessments in full 90 days prior to discharge from probation
*Complete 90 days jail on each case, with consideration for home detention for the second half of his sentence if acceptable by the jail administration
after having completed the first 45 days in jail with Huber privileges for counseling and employment - concurrent with Count 1 
*60 days to report for jail to commence
*Report to jail today for start date
*Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1

16CF432:
Count 1 -
Impose/Stay 4 year prison sentence - concurrent to 16CF47
2 years of initial confinement - if probation revoked, eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program
2 years of extended supervision - would be the same as probation conditions
23 days of incarceration credit, if probation is revoked
**Placed on Probation for 36 months - concurrent
Conditions of Probation:
*Complete 90 days jail on each case, with consideration for home detention for the second half of his sentence if acceptable by the jail administration
after having completed the first 45 days in jail with Huber privileges for counseling and employment  - concurrent to Counts 1 & 3 in 16CF47
*60 days to report for jail to commence
*Report to jail today for start date
*Pay costs
*Pay DNA Surcharge
*Pay costs and assessments in full 90 days prior to discharge from probation
*Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1 of 16CF47

**BOND MONIES TO BE APPLIED TO COSTS/SURCHARGES

Defendant informed of firearm rights and voting eligibility
Sentencing hearing on April 21, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Benjamin R. Kubisiak in court with attorney Eric Sheets. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 16CF47, 16CF124, 16CF264 & 16CF432.

9:04 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement and indicates the parties would be requesting a PSI.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
Court makes statements regarding the plea agreement.
Prosecutor clarifies his plea agreement.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
16CF47:
Count 1 - No contest
Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - No contest
Count 4 - DRI

16CF124:
Count 1 - DRI

16CF264:
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 - DRI

16CF432:
Count 1 - No contest
Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - DRI

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 & 3 of 16CF47 and Count 1 of 16CF432 and Count 2 & 4 on 16CF47 will be DRI, Count 1 of 16CF124 will be DRI, Count 1 & 2 of 16CF264 will be DRI and Count 2 & 3 of 16CF432 will be DRI.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Knaapen indicates that this defendant may be an appropriate candidate for the upcoming drug court and could be evaluated to see if would be eligible.
Atty Sheets makes his statements in agreement.

BY THE COURT:
PSI to be ordered.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 21, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 3, 2017 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on November 28, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 24, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 6, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on July 25, 2016 at 11:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 31, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 25, 2016 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Benjamin R. Kubisiak in court.  Atty Sheets arrives at 11:19 a.m. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case is set for Bail/Bond Review today.

11:18 a.m. Court indicates the reason for the hearing was to determine that the wage assignment has been set.
Court makes statements regarding the wage assignment.
11:21 a.m.  Atty Knaapen states the appearances for the record.  
Atty Knaapen makes additional statement.
Atty Sheets makes a statement.

BY THE COURT:
No changes to case today.
Portage County Community Justice Program Court Referral Form

Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Paul Dopp
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Participate in the Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming.

**AMENDED as of February 11, 2016:
Appear at all future court dates and the failure to do so will result in bond being revoked
Pay $2,000 cash to be released and then set up a wage assignment until an additional $3,500 is posted - $200 per pay period which is $100 per week.
Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  7 times.

Defendant Benjamin R. Kubisiak in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Defendant Benjamin R. Kubisiak in custody. David R Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Set for a Motion Hearing to Modify Bond.

11:36 p.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.
Atty Sheets makes statement regarding his motion to modify the bond for his client.
Atty Sheets states that his client is indigent and not able to post the $50,000 cash bond previously requested.
Atty Sheets would like it amended to a $5,000 cash bond with $1,000 to be released and then a wage assignment for the remaining $4,000 and states his reasons on the record as to why the bond should be modified.
Atty Knaapen states his objection to the modification of the bond and states his reasons on the record.
Atty Sheets responds to the objection of Atty Knaapen.

BY THE COURT:
Cash bond amended.

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

Defendant Benjamin R. Kubisiak in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Defendant Benjamin R. Kubisiak in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:41 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Reduce Bond filed by Atty Eric Sheets
Request from the defendant for a bail reduction hearing dated 01/21/16
